alert.note: Alert for Craig; Creek; Nowata; Osage; Pawnee; Rogers; Tulsa; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 26 at 4:25AM CDT until July 26 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Critical fire weather conditions expected today... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR PARTS OF NORTHEAST OKLAHOMA FOR VERY DRY FUELS WITH LOW HUMIDITY AND EXTREME TEMPERATURES... The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon today to 9 PM CDT this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...In Oklahoma, Osage, Washington, Nowata, Craig, Pawnee, Tulsa, Rogers, and Creek counties. * WIND...South to southwest wind gusting to around 20 miles an hour. * HUMIDITY...18 to 25 percent. * TEMPERATURE...105 to 109 degrees. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly and may exhibit extreme behavior. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that a dangerous combination of weather conditions and dry vegetation is expected within 24 hours, favoring rapid growth and spread of any wildfires. The primary weather factors include stronger winds, lower humidities, and warmer temperatures.

area.areaDesc: Craig; Creek; Nowata; Osage; Pawnee; Rogers; Tulsa; Washington
